lexUnit.name: wig.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for the head made of real or artificial hair.

sentence.text: Hair was the big news , with full skirts made of artificial hair and wondrous Jacobean wigs in auburn .
And she marched out of the kitchen , her tall wig swaying slightly with the brisk jerky movement .
In desperation he tugged of his wig and looked pleadingly at them .
The man slipped off the couch , wriggled his feet into his enormous high-heeled shoes and tugged his wig on .
Now those clothes are as much a trademark as were Andy Warhol 's ill-fitting silver wigs .
Pike was curled up into a ball , like a hedgehog , clutching his wig to him the way a kid might hold on to its teddy before going to sleep .
Early in the evening , Jean Baptiste pulls off his wig of flowing white locks to disclose an identical head of hair beneath .
He sported a wig composed from shredded J-Cloths , a present from his wife .
` You see , Marco , they found the cape and the blonde wig . "
Imagine , she told him , Aricie in ice-cream pink tights and Britannicus in a weird gold curly wig and a little clattering metal skirt .
There are three men in wigs .
` Five over here , " said a big fat man in a shameless wig .
He could at least spend the money on it that he would have used in buying a ticket to see Dinah , in powdered wig and paduasoy , as Lady Teazle , once again .
His eyes were clear but his white wig was askew .
Here he took off the pendulous wig , wiped his face on the yellowing lace handkerchief dripping out of the over-ornate and antique jacket and revealed himself as a young man .
The judge , Lord Morison , and both Crown and defence counsel took off their wigs and gowns before the girl appeared on screen from another room in the building .
The judge wears a wig .
She was an old woman , she wore a red wig , and she had black teeth .
But still to come , should men wear wigs ?
Sandra , a full-time barrister and a mother of three , says some judges are known to be partial to women in wigs and gowns .
His wig was now at a slight angle .
